extendedInfo.description: Light up your home screen with lanterns, clouds drifting lazily past, and stars twinkling in the darkness. Customize the background by turning the moon and cloud layers on and off in the settings screen.Supports all screen sizes including tablets.Art by Anne PÃ¤tzke.

reviews.title: Only clouds move...
reviews.comment: Would love this if the moon turned or the stars sparkled like the nightfall wallpaper. If you dislike the clouds and turn them off, there is nothing live about the wallpaper...
reviews.author: Gabrielle Dyer

reviews.title: Battery hogger
reviews.comment: Started using 74% of my battery with no explanation as to why, even with all the features turned off. Which, considering I paid for this app for those features, it\'s unbearably frustrating.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: What did u do to these?????
reviews.comment: They\'re too zoomed in and don\'t fit my screen anymore! I loved these wallpapers and now they\'re useless to me. Please fix!
reviews.author: Jeanine Puciata

reviews.title: No scrolling feature?
reviews.comment: I thought there was..Please add one!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: I love this and the Starlight Live Wallpaper by Jason Allen/Anne Patzke.  The wallpaper itself is very smooth.  I love the lanterns and the clouds (although it\'s physically weird for the wind to be blowing simultaneously in different directions).  My only gripe is that the wallpaper seems to glitch out my screen in patches when I\'m in a full screen program.  This occurs a lot with things like my eReader apps.  The glitch goes away when I nudge my page to smooth out the white space/words.  The areas on the screen where this happens is right in the path of the moving clouds.  This is not something that occurs with the Starlight LWP that I used to use prior to switching to Passage LWP.  Should this glitching be addressed, I\'d definitely give 5 stars.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Perfict
reviews.comment: This runs perfect on a Asus T300
reviews.author: Darryl Perry
